skillTree.localised_description: The finest horses in the Old World, bred for their endurance and fiery temperament, barded for further protection.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (fear and terror).
Witnessing friendly units with the Peasant Attribute rout will not affect this unit's leadership.

skillTree.localised_description: Thorough drilling increases the peasants' chances of withstanding the horrors of battle.
Desecrated and stripped of his titles, this lord has no other choice left than travel to Mousillon and start his life all over again, awaiting for a chance to get revenge..

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 when fighting against Bretonnia
	(Lord's army)
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Bretonnia

skillTree.localised_description: "In time they will come to see that fear is a great motivator, and thank us for that gift."

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: A Knightly formation, even in death these Bretonnian knights will use their renowned lance formation.

effects.description:

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Whereby the power of death itself is used to hold back the physical world.

ui_effects.localised_text: Unit is invulnerable to damage (does not apply to summoned units)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: Mallobaude possesses a charisma and persuasiveness that is the equal of any true Grail Knight. Though the “truth” that Mallobaude believes about Bretonnia is outlandish and frankly difficult to believe, Mallobaude states it with such conviction that many who have heard it have believed him completely.

Some of the nobles with whom Mallobaude deals have the vilest reputations as Necromancers, Witches, and even blood-drinking fiends, and yet Mallobaude courts them all, caring only whether they can help him in furthering his aims.

effects.description:
Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Mallobaude is an extremely honour-bound knight and has never executed a fellow noble. Instead, he gives them a chance to survive through single combat with him. In truth, this is not much of a chance as Mallobaude is one of the most skilful warriors ever born into Bretonnian chivalry, but the idea of slaughtering a nobleman like an animal is still unacceptable to Mallobaude.
Should the King of Bretonnia attempt to invade Mousillon, the living will march alongside the dead in Mallobaude's army.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for melee infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for melee infantry units
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: +33% casualties suffered from Vampiric territory attrition
	(enemy armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: With his charm and talking skills, Mallobaude has managed to get the peasantry to fanatically follow him wherever his quest for the Crown of Bretonnia leads him. They no longer fear death and are utterly devoted to Mallobaude's cause.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Frenzy" for all Peasant units
	(Lord's army)

Passive ability: "Fanatic Peasantry" for all Peasant units

	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Be it a living peasant or an undead zombie, they shall learn to stand fast and brace against the charge.

Passive ability: "Aura of Dark Majesty"
	(replaces: "Aura of Majesty")

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
As an expert in such matters, it is their duty to know the king's law and to mete justice in his name.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
The Lord is entitled to collect tithes from tenants in return for continued protection.
"The land from here to the sea is yours, if you enforce the king's will."
Such a beast is all but impossible to destroy - an immortal horror doomed to haunt eternity!

effects.description:

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
This Lord has endless forbearance, a timeless patience crafted over millennia.

factionEffects.localised_description: Mousillon is the smallest, poorest, and most cursed of the dukedoms of Bretonnia. The city of Mousillon stands near the mouth of the River Grismerie, surrounded by swamps. It seems to be slowly crumbling back into the swamp, but somehow it still survives.

effects.description: Defeating a Bretonnian faction leader in battle will vassalise their faction (except Couronne, Carcassonne and Chevaliers de Lyonesse)
Allegiance points gained: +50% for alliances and vassalage with Bretonnia

items.colour_text: Mallobaude's personal standard, the Golden Serpent on Black Shield, flies above his troops, announcing to his enemies that the Serpent of Mousillon himself is their opponent.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (fear and terror).

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

items.colour_text: This jewel-studded chalice has been fashioned in the likeness of a skull, and will give any who continually sup from it one of two things: salvation or death.

"Witness the armour of black, the unraised visor, the iron-clad fist that rules from the shadows! Yes, darkness is abroad, from the City of the Damned to the hovels of the wretched. Mousillon is lost indeed, and if you seek to find it, traveller, you will find only death."

related_attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute ignore the effects of enemy contact effects such as  Poison

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Mallobaude, also known as The Serpent or The Black Knight, is a mysterious knight who has appointed himself Duke of Mousillon. He is both a magnificent warrior and a man whose honour and principles are bound in iron.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each kill made by the unit.
